title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 475.2 - Effect of suspension or revocation of permits
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 475.2 - Effect of suspension or revocation of permits

State Regulations

Tax Law, ยง 502
(a) Whenever a permit is suspended or
revoked, the plate or sticker issued for the motor vehicle is also suspended or
revoked and both the permit and plate or sticker must be surrendered
immediately to the State Tax Commission upon receipt of the order of suspension
or revocation. Thereafter the motor vehicle cannot be operated on the public
highways of this State. (b) The
suspension or revocation of a permit automatically results in the suspension or
revocation of all permits and plates and stickers issued to the carrier under
this statute, unless the commission in its order specifies otherwise. Accordingly, upon suspension or revocation of a permit all the permits and
plates and stickers issued to the carrier for all motor vehicles must be
surrendered immediately to the commission and such vehicles cannot be operated
on the public highways of this State. (c) If the permit of any motor vehicle
registered in this State has been suspended or revoked, the Department of Motor

Vehicles will not thereafter re-register the motor vehicle or transfer the
registration of ownership, until the commission issues to the department a
certificate to the effect that such person has fully complied with the
provisions of article 21 of the Tax Law. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
ยง
475.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
